intro: Acinodendron pseudopetronianum, commonly known as the false petronia, is a shrub native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are often white or pale yellow in color. The fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds.
